metadata.title: CVE-2017-5836 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
The plist_free_data function in plist.c in libplist allows attackers tocause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving an integer nodethat is treated as a PLIST_KEY and then triggers an invalid free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5836` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libplist++3v5 - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
libplist-utils - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
libplist3 - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
python3-plist - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libplist package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3').
